sentences.en: A fire was burning merrily in the grate.
A small coal fire burned in the grate.
sentences.cn: 炉子里生着小小的煤火.

sentences.en: A wood fire burned in the grate.
As everyone knows, this kind of voice can grate on your nerves.
sentences.cn: 这是谁也可以想象出来的一种难听的声音.

sentences.en: Finely grate about a teaspoon of orange zest and put aside.
sentences.cn: 将橙皮擦出大约一茶匙的细末待用。

sentences.en: Grate a tablespoonful of fresh ginger into a pan.
sentences.cn: 磨碎一汤匙鲜姜，放入平底锅。
将一些已经酿熟的切达干酪磨碎。

sentences.en: Grate the carrot finely / into small pieces.
Grate the cheese into a mixing bowl.
sentences.cn: 将干酪磨碎放进搅拌碗中。

sentences.en: I'll dish up and you can grate the Parmesan.
sentences.cn: 我来上菜，你把帕尔马干酪磨碎。

sentences.en: Robina struck a match and held it to the crumpled newspaper in the grate.
sentences.cn: 罗比娜划着一根火柴去点壁炉里揉皱的报纸。

sentences.en: the dim glow of the fire in the grate
The fire in the grate, too, had burned low.
sentences.cn: 炉栅里的火也已经很微弱了.

sentences.en: There was a fire in the grate.
There were red coals in the grate.

words.tran_cn: 摩擦器；磨光机；[木] 粗齿木锉
[光] 光栅；摩擦，摩擦声；格子

trans.tran_en: the metal bars and frame that hold the wood, coal etc in a  fireplace

trans.tran_cn: 吱嘎磨碎； 使人烦躁， 刺激
trans.tran_en: to rub cheese, vegetables etc against a rough or sharp surface in order to break them into small pieces

trans.tran_cn: 发出刺耳的摩擦声，使人烦恼难受
